name: Real Aeroclub de Malaga
about: The Real Aeroclub de Malaga, established in 1934, is a renowned flying school located at the Leoni Benabú Airfield in Axarquia, Malaga, Spain. With a rich history spanning nearly a century, the club offers comprehensive aviation training, enabling students to obtain their Aircraft Private Pilot license under the guidance of experienced instructors. The school operates in an ideal environment for flight conditions, providing controlled flight navigation and cross-country training. The club's fleet includes aircraft such as Piper Cherokee 161s, ensuring students receive hands-on experience in suitable flight conditions. Joining the Real Aeroclub de Malaga allows aspiring pilots to embark on a fulfilling aviation career with a legacy of excellence and dedication.
